_header: The liver maketh a man to love
_description: Parts of the body influencing man’s faculties — twelve irregular non-rhyming lines

CamMagPep1236.First Lines:
The lyuer maketh a man to loueThe longys cawsyth the tonge to
                    speke…
CamMagPep1236.Last Lines:
…Couetyse cometh fro the stomakeLoue cometh fro the
                    splene
CamMagPep1236.Note:
Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943 number mis-written in Hamer (1995)
XHamer,  Richard. 
             A Manuscript Index to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: British Library, 1995.
CamMagPep1236.Attributed Title: The condycyons that be in man (f. 91)
